channel.title: PC help
channel.description:
So this morning i used my PC normally, no sign of any trouble Then later i booted it up again, however the monitor doesn't seem to connect with my PC I checked all the cables, and tried a different monitor, tried a different cable and still no luck, i also noticed that windows doesn't seem to startup (usually i would hear the startup music, but there was none)
I checked the internet for some solutions, tried some but still no luck So you guys have any idea what's wrong & how to fix it? Or i'll just take it to a technician?

item.title: PC help
item.dc:creator: Gasher
item.description:
There could be a possibility that it IS your motherboard battery. It’s more likely to be a dead board (if you are indeed getting no beeps), but mb batteries are dirt cheap and I would start there. I have had this happen to me once… I think that with some MBs, no battery = no PC.

Read full topic

item.title: PC help
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
your computer has died, try replacing components without any particular order

starting with the most dubious parts

Read full topic

item.title: PC help
item.dc:creator: Nerdguy
item.description:
It says no signal
Not sure i have any, but i’ll try to find one
Beep how? Beep sounds? Beep lights?
Ok i’ll try that later

Read full topic

item.title: PC help
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Does the monitor say “no signal” or is it simply blank (black)?
Also, try connecting to the onboard GPU if you have one.
Also, does the PC beep when you turn it on?
Also, clear the CMOS (remove the battery).

Read full topic
